snippet: A federal appeals court rejected the law as an unreasonable search because it applied to all applicants for benefits regardless of whether there was cause for suspicion.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for 11th Circuit rejects 2011 Florida law requiring drug tests for anyone applying for welfare benefits; rules law is unreasonable search because state officials did not prove a more prevalent drug abuse problem among welfare applicants than in general population.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court rejected the law as an unreasonable search because it applied to all applicants for benefits regardless of whether there was cause for suspicion.

headline.main: Court Strikes Down Drug Tests for Florida Welfare Applicants
headline.print_headline: Court Strikes Down Drug Tests for Florida Welfare Applicants
